content.raw:
drifted 4 inches after how long?

Also, assuming you are using nightly builds, what does 
~~~
dpkg -l | grep gazebo
~~~
and
~~~
dpkg -l | grep drcsim
~~~
report?

If you are getting a different release number (pay close attention to the number after version numbers `1.8.1` and `2.6.2`), an update might be in order.   In which case, please try:

~~~
sudo apt-get remove osrf-common* sandia-hand* gazebo* drcsim*
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install drcsim-nightly
~~~

and see if you get an updated version?

If you are getting a different release number (pay close attention to the number after version numbers 1.8.1 and 2.6.2), an update might be in order. In which case, please try:
